adrFormatAddress: 570 10th Ave, New York, NY 10036, USA

editorialSummary.text: Bright YOTEL spot with plants & wood floors for New American cuisine from breakfast to late-night.

originalText.text: Loved Regina at the bar!! She is awesome, my espresso martini was the best I’ve ever had! She is so friendly and sweet. Loved meeting her!! She made our day!!❤️ Happy holidays Regina

text.text: Loved Regina at the bar!! She is awesome, my espresso martini was the best I’ve ever had! She is so friendly and sweet. Loved meeting her!! She made our day!!❤️ Happy holidays Regina

originalText.text: Our waitress was attentive to our needs, and the food was amazing! The flavors and seasonings were crafted to blend in your palate seamlessly. I will definitely come back to enjoy more of what this restaurant has to offer. The flavors of the drinks were creative, and developed with care.

I will definitely come back to enjoy more of what this restaurant has to offer. The flavors of the drinks were creative, and developed with care.

originalText.text: After a long day of traveling,  we opted to eat at our hotel instead of venturing out. So delicious! Don't skip the amazing gochujang braised pork tacos!

text.text: After a long day of traveling,  we opted to eat at our hotel instead of venturing out. So delicious! Don't skip the amazing gochujang braised pork tacos!

originalText.text:
Green Fig in Manhattan is nothing short of a delight. From the moment you walk in, you're greeted with a vibrant atmosphere that feels both welcoming and sophisticated. The menu is diverse, offering a splendid mix of flavors that cater to both traditional and adventurous palates.

But what truly sets Green Fig apart is the impeccable service. A special shout-out to Carlos, the manager. He exemplifies what great leadership and customer service should be. Not only is he attentive and professional, but he also exudes genuine warmth and politeness. His dedication to ensuring every guest has a memorable experience is evident, and his helpfulness is unparalleled.

In a city filled with dining options, Green Fig stands out not just for its fantastic food but also for the unmatched service, particularly from stalwarts like Carlos. Looking forward to many more visits!

originalText.text:
Great place!
My family and I originally intended to go to the Rustic Table for Brunch (on Sunday).  Looked up wait times in google which said, “No wait.”
However, by the time we arrived there, around 11:30am, the place was packed (it is small) and they told us 35-45 min wait for a party of 4.
We were pressed for time, therefore, we immediately googled the closest place for brunch. The Green Fig showed up. It looked spacious, nice,
and only a 3 min. walk. We immediately headed there and, at first, couldn’t see it on the street.
It was because it is in the fourth floor of the Yotel.
We were presently surprised coming off the elevator. The place had a beautiful chic and modern style.  And the hostesses greeted us very courteously.
Our server Andreana was superb - very friendly and helpful.
We had the Greek Omelette, the Brioche Benedict, and the White Egg Frittata. The presentation of the food was outstanding and the taste delicious!!!  The prices were very reasonable for a hotel restaurant and the quality of the food.
Definitely an outstanding find!
I will definitely be back!
